item.title: Collectibles: Top 3 Best Picks £10-£13 Deals & Guide
item.description:
Top 3 collectibles picks for every budget: excellent finds at £10–£13

Find three of the best collectibles to buy right now in the £10–£13 range — a limited-edition Lurpak toast rack and two vintage gilt pheasant glasses — all ideal if you want cheap collectibles that still look special. These picks work for display, gifting, or adding character to a home bar or kitchen cabinet, and they’re all collectibles for sale in the UK with buy options on eBay.

item.title: Video Games Deals: Best Picks Under £88 — Buy Guide
item.description:
Best Video Games Under £88 — A Buyer’s Guide

If you want to buy video games or gaming gear in the UK without breaking the bank, these three listings are genuinely worth a look. You’ll find a pair of Valve Index knuckle controllers (left and right) at sensible replacement prices, plus a brand-new copy of Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island — a heavyweight board-game experience that plays like an RPG. Read on for specific specs, why each item is worth buying, what to watch for, and my top pick.

item.title: Best Tech & Electronics Deals Under £40 — Top Picks
item.description:
Best Tech & Electronics You Can Buy Right Now — practical picks under £40

If you want useful tech & electronics that actually improve your day without breaking the bank, these four picks — from a novelty mug to a full VDSL modem router — are worth a look. Each item is priced between £14 and £40, ships from the UK seller on eBay, and is ready to solve a specific problem: better posture, safer cycling, a fun desk cup, or faster home broadband.

item.title: General Buying Guide: Best General Deals £10–£86 — Top Picks
item.description:
Comparing the Best General at Every Price Point

Want the best general buys on eBay UK between £10 and £86? This guide distills 8 real listings across practical home gear, hobby kits, and pocket-friendly tech. Read quick picks by price tier, exact prices and conditions, care and sizing tips, plus a clear winner recommendation for different buyer types.

What this guide covers

You’ll find budget picks (£10–£20), mid-range finds (£21–£50) and best-value/near-premium items up to £86. I’ve inspected specs, materials and likely trade-offs so you can confidently buy general items online in the UK.

item.title: General Deals: Best Value Picks & Top Finds UK This Week
item.description:
Best General Deals This Week — top value picks from 18 listings

If you search “General” or “buy general online UK” you’ll find thousands of listings — this roundup pulls the best general deals from a pool of 18 listings in the £10–£86 range so you don’t have to. Expect model train kit, homeware, tech and workshop kit — each pick includes price, condition, shipping info and a direct eBay link so you can buy general goods fast.

item.title: Best Glassware & Drinkware: Pheasant Gold Glasses Deals
item.description:
What’s New in Glassware & Drinkware — Latest Listings

If you’re refreshing a home bar or hunting for a standout gift, vintage-inspired glassware is an easy way to add character. Right now there are a few eye-catching pheasant-themed pieces listed that mix retro charm with practical use. These are affordable, collectible, and great for whiskey, beer, or as decorative accents — especially if you like gold-rimmed details.

Below are three current listings in the same price bracket that are worth a look. Each is listed at £17.69 and ships internationally for free. I’ve included the exact eBay links so you can buy glassware & drinkware directly.

item.title: Computers, Tablets & Network Hardware: New vs Used Deals
item.description:
New vs Used Computers, Tablets & Network Hardware: Which Is the Better Deal?

If you’re shopping in the computers, tablets & network hardware category on a budget, there are solid options both new and pre-owned. Small accessories and peripherals often do just as well used, while routers and scanners may benefit from buying new or lightly used with a return window. Below I compare four real listings in the £14–£67 range so you can decide what to buy now, whether you want cheap stands, a portable scanner, or a reliable router.

item.title: Buy Collectibles Online: Best Affordable Collectibles
item.description:
The Ultimate Guide to Buying Collectibles Online

Collecting is part treasure hunt, part personal history. Whether you’re drawn to model planes, boxed book sets, or military aviation replicas, buying collectibles online opens up options you won’t find locally. The three listings below fall in the £27–£41 range — affordable enough to start or expand a collection without breaking the bank. I’ll walk you through what makes each item worth buying, what to watch for when shopping, and how to score the best finds.

item.title: Best Glassware & Drinkware Under £17 — Pheasant Glasses
item.description:
Best Glassware & Drinkware Under £17 — A Buyer’s Guide

Finding statement pieces for your bar or kitchen doesn’t have to cost a lot. These three vintage-style pheasant glasses bring personality, a touch of gold gilt, and genuine mid-century charm — all at a budget-friendly price. They’re great if you collect unique glasses, want a single replacement piece, or are building a matched set gradually with multibuy listings.

All three listings below are priced at £17.69 and include free international shipping. Each listing is for a single glass (x1) and marked as multibuy so you can add more later if you want a full set.

item.title: Best Computers, Tablets & Network Hardware Deals This Week
item.description:
Best Computers, Tablets & Network Hardware Deals This Week

If you’re shopping for practical gear—portable accessories, small stands, or a solid home router—these four bargains are worth a look. They cover useful, everyday upgrades without breaking the bank: everything from a portable A4 scanner to a TP-Link Archer VR600 modem-router. Prices range from £13.61 to £66.73, and each listing links straight to eBay so you can buy computers, tablets & network hardware accessories quickly.
